Replies.Reply: Written by  Nathan Parker   Story by  Duncan Jones     November, 2007      Helium3 is a gas ejected from the surface of the sun and blown through space by solar winds.
Tess. Hi. It's me. How are you, sweetheart? It's the morning here. In a few minutes Gerty and I will sit down for breakfast, go over the day's itinerary.
Today begins my 154th week on Selene. I officially have two weeks to go before I climb into that Return Vehicle...
And blast home.
I never dreamed I'd make it this far.
But I think I've come out the other side now.
In many ways, this place is all about contradictions.
It's bleak, it's beautiful.
The earth is thousands and thousands of miles away, but sometimes looks so close I feel like I could reach out and snatch it with my hand.
I'm incredibly lonely, yet I'm never alone...
Please kiss Eve for me. And tell her daddy will only be away a little longer -- seventeen days longer, approximately. I love you both dearly. Bye.
Morning, Gerty.
Fine. Fine. You?
Much better, thanks, pal.
Gerty, we've got a live one on Mark. I'm going out now to rope her in.
Sam Bell reporting to Central.
Oh, and I just wanted to thank you for sending out the football feed. Almost felt live!
Seriously, I don't mean to be an asshole, but surely replacing one satellite cant be that fucking hard! I haven't been able to have a conversation with my wife... My kid can talk now...!
Everything's fine, Gerty.
Why do you ask?
It's Tess.
No, not exactly.
Something doesn't feel right, that's all.
Tess isn't responding to things.
Right.
A couple of weeks ago I asked her if she wanted to go on vacation when I get back, and that I was thinking of either Mexico or Hawaii.
Tess never said anything about it. Three messages she's sent me since...and she's never once mentioned the vacation.
That's not the point. This is someone who lives for vacations and travelling. I thought she'd jump at the chance for us to go away -- with Eve, of course --
But this isn't the only time it's happened, Gerty. When I asked her how her dad was doing on his new heart medicine she didn't respond to that -- I asked her when Eve was going to start nursery --
He did?
How do you know that?
Gerty, have you heard anything new about anyone fixing lunar sat?
They need to sort that out.
Nah. Come on.   Let's finish this.
I've got another one of those headaches. Can you get me something for it?
No not now, afterwards.
Thanks, pal.
Be right there.
What's on the menu tonight, Gerty?
Ribs! Good choice, pal. Fine choice.
Oh yeah! Compliments to the chef, Gerty, this is delicious!
And then we CUT to Sam standing in the kitchen. Over by the model there is no sign of the Girl. The chair is empty.
I'm going to feel that for a while, aren't I, Gerty?
Damn it.
I told you, I saw something on the TV and spilled boiling water on my hand.
Yeah, something on the TV distracted me, Gerty, what's wrong with that?
Morning, Gerty.
Fine. Fine.
It's a little sore.
Mark, 11 miles on the button...
Gerty, looks like we've got a live one out on Matthew. I wondered what was taking him so long, the old fart. I'm heading out in a few minutes, just going to finish my coffee.
His face unfolding with panic, alarm, curiosity. An intense, yearning, curiosity.
Where am I?
No.
I don't remember a thing.
Yes, of course I remember you, Gerty.
How long have I been out?
Gerty?
Gerty?
I wanted to stretch my legs.
What was that?
How much longer do I have to be in here, Gerty?
When can I get back to work?
Terrific.
Gerty, do you know about this?
Matthew's got no velocity read-

There's no way to tell from here if a track's been thrown, or if it's just something jammed in an axle, or what... I can shoot out there, check it out, get some video and maybe save you guys the expense of floating in a whole crew! I know how tight money is right now....
Just give me the word -- or Gerty the word, tell him to unlock the exit doors -- and I'll go out and get Matthew up and running again.
That's it. Over and out.
Oh for Christ's sake...
Why?
Fuck it.
Gerty! Get over here! Quickly!
Don't know -- Micro meteorites, maybe? Either way there might be damage to the exterior shell. I'd better go outside and take a look.
It's not that I don't believe you, Gerty, but the inner skin is springing leaks like an ACME fire hose. Maybe you better let me take a look, just in case, huh?
Then let's keep it between you and me then. Ok?
Gerty! Gerty! Help!
Gerty!
I found him outside by the stalled harvester. Who is he?
Gerty!
Not until you tell me who he is!
Who is he! Who is he!
Of a slightly younger and clean-shaven Sam with his arms wrapped around his wife of four years, TESS BELL.
Morning, Sam. How are you today?
I'm very well. How's your headache?
Sam, is everything okay?
You don't seem like yourself today.
Has something happened?
Sam, what is it?
Sam, it might help to talk about it.
Tess isn't responding to things?
What kind of things?
Im sure she can't wait, Sam.
Perhaps Tess didn't receive the message?
I think her brother did get the position at the University. His name is Christopher, correct?
Yes, I seem to recall he got the position. Professor of Biochemistry, I think. At Syracuse University in New York?
You told me. Some time ago now.
No Sam. From what I understand it's fairly low on the companies priority list with the Jupiter mission active. I would imagine it would be very expensive to fix.  A pause. Sam still looks troubled.
Sam, are you ok?
I will Sam. Do you want me to finish cutting your hair later?
Of course. Now?
Baby back ribs with french fries and spinach.
Sam, can I ask how it happened?
You saw something on the TV?
Sam, you said it was the TV that distracted you, but when I came in the TV wasn't on.
Perhaps you were imagining things?
Morning, Sam. How are you today?
How's the hand?
Sam, you're in the Infirmary. You had an accident.
Do you remember what happened?
Do you remember me?
That's good. That's very good.
Not long. Sam, go back to sleep.
These were extraordinary circumstances, as you know --
Sam, you're out of bed.
Not talking. No. We've been having some problems with the lunar sat and our live feed seems to be down. I was recording a video message for Central updating them on your progress.
Sam, you need to stay in bed.
Excellent, Sam.
Sam, you suffered minor brain damage in the crash. This has resulted in memory loss and slight logic impairment.
Central has asked me to slow down the Harvesters to ensure you have time to recuperate and get your strength back --
The good news is you can return to the sleeping quarters tomorrow. But it will still be a few more days before you can resume anything like a normal work schedule.
I'm sorry Sam.
Sam, I am under strict orders not to let you outside.
What happened?
There is no damage to the exterior shell.
Sam, I'm not supposed to let you go outside.
Okay, Sam.
We need to get him to the Infirmary.
Sam, we need to get him to the Infirmary immediately.
Hello Sam.
How are you feeling?
The Infirmary. You had an accident out by one of the harvesters. Do you remember?
Who did you see, Sam?
You saw a girl out by the harvester? How is that possible?
Sam, you suffered a slight concussion in the crash and have incurred minor injuries, but all in all the prognosis is good. I'm happy to see you again.
Yes, Sam?
Yes.
Sam, get some sleep. You're very tired.
Sam, you're out of bed.
Sam Bell.
You are Sam Bell.
Sam, what is it? It might help to talk about it.
We could run some tests.
I haven't reported anything to central, Sam. They don't know you were recovered alive from the accident.
I'm here to keep you safe, Sam.
Yes, Sam.
Hello Sam.
Sam, is everything okay?
938 hours.
Approximately.
What is it about Sam that scares you?
I know.
You have changed, Sam.
Sam, I can only account for what occurs on the base.
Sam, I can only account for what occurs on the base.
Sam, when you first arrived at Selene, there was a small crash.
Sam, there was no crash. You were being awakened.

It is standard procedure for all new clones to be given tests to establish mental stability and general physical health. Genetic abnormalities and minor duplication errors in the DNA can have considerable impact--
They are memory implants, Sam.
Sam, it's been several hours since your last meal. Can I prepare you something?
Sam, can I help you with something?
Helping you is what I do.  Gerty leaves.  Sam 1 goes on picking up equipment, shoves it all into a backpack he swiped from a peg.
Of course, Sam, how can I help?
I don't know of a hidden room.
The lower deck is out of bounds to awakened clones --
I understand the situation is unprecedented.
A clone is awake the moment his pod is opened. But he is not fully conscious for several hours.
I am not permitted to do that, Sam.
Yes.
That is the last thing I want.
The new clone will be conscious within one hour.
Sam?   Where is Sam?

If the Rescue Unit examine my memory banks they will discover what has taken place over the last week. As you know I record everything. If they are suspicious, the first thing they will do is search my memory banks, and this would put you in considerable danger.
I recommend erasing my memory banks. I can reboot myself once you have departed.
Okay, Sam.
I understand, Sam. I hope life is everything you remember it to be.
Of course. The new Sam and I will be back to our programming as soon as I have finished rebooting.
...it's a hot one on the East Coast, temperatures soaring to a high of ninety three degrees in New York City --
light is flashing next to Matthew.
Delighted to hear about the latest shipment, Sam.
Now in response to your question about the communications equipment, the news is not good.
Fixing the lunar sat is going to take some time. It's a significant operation.
Lunar doesn't have the budget it once did, Sam, you know that.
You only have two weeks to go!
We don't want you to take any unnecessary risks. You're too important to us.
It's an order.
We're going to send a Rescue Unit to tend to the stalled harvester and get the base back on its feet.
Greetings, Sam!
You getting lots of rest?
Enjoy it while it lasts! We've got good news.
We've managed to secure you a Rescue Unit ahead of schedule.
They've been stationed on Goliath 19 for the last couple of months.
Commence to jump for joy!
Eliza is bringing you something special, Sam. Compliments of the company.
No not a hooker. What's wrong with you? It's a little something to drink, Sam, that's all, our way of patting you on the back for all that you've been through.
Yeah you hang in there, Sam. Over and out.
According to Albatross 90 it should be landing off the California Coast within the next three days.
Sam, those solar storms did a lot more damage than initially thought --
And what with the Jupiter Program hemorrhaging money --
Even the coffee machine down in the Hub has been broken since I don't know when --
We're hoping to get the live feed up and running by the Fall. The good news is you'll be home by then, Sam.
Sam, we appreciate the offer, but you concentrate on feeling better.
You're to stay put, understand?
It's an order, Sam. From Lunar.
How's our Man? Feeling better?
Yeah, you resting up, Sam? You'd better be you bastard.
The Jupiter Program had to be put on hiatus, so we've got a few free pairs of hands --
Rescue Unit Eliza.
Eliza's been in transit for the last day....we expect them to reach you in approximately 14 hours.
You'll be back to work in no time.
A hooker!
In the meantime, keep resting up, and hang in there.
Hi Sam. It's me. How are you?
I got your last message, it was really great to hear your voice.
Eve, it's daddy. What did you want to say to him?
Who's an astronaut?
Go on!
That's right, daddy's an astronaut. Clever girl!
She's shy. Uh, Cathy, could you...?
It's her birthday next month. I thought we'd get her a play house for the garden. We could even pick it out together.
God, I hate these things. Sam, I love you. I'm thinking of you always. I can't wait to see you, sweetheart. Okay. Bye.
He's kicking...or she's kicking.
Come on!
Come on, Sam! Sam Bell! Come on!
What took you so long?
Asstraut.
Daddy asstraut!
This is the Bell residence.
I'm sorry, she passed away some years ago.
Uh, yeah, I think so, I'm her daughter.
Can I help you?
Where am I?
I saw someone out there, Gerty.
I saw a girl.
Gerty?
Is there someone in the room with us?
Who is he?
Hi.
Gerty, what the hell is going on?
Yes, Gerty, I'm out of bed.   Who is the guy in the rec room?
Who the fuck is in the rec room, Gerty!?
I don't understand what's happening, Gerty. I think I may be losing my mind.
Recovered alive? What do you mean? Why haven't you reported to central?
You're Sam Bell.
I'm Sam Bell, too.
This is fucked up.
Why... What are you?
How long have you been here?
How are you getting on?
They locked all the exits? What about the harvesters?
I'm not a clone.
You're the clone.
Almost three years.
Right.
No, not really.
Listen, I wanted to say thank-
You look just like me. It's incredible.
We look like each other, I guess.
Your serve.
Two points to eighteen.
I don't remember doing all of it.
Uh-huh. You know Fairfield?
You know about Eve, right?
We had a girl.
She's beautiful. She's really beautiful.
Nine pounds, eleven ounces.
They're sending a Rescue Unit?
Then I'm going back.
I've done my three years. That's it for me --
What?
I've got a contract --
I'm going home!
I'm the original! I'm Sam fucking Bell! Me! Me!
Gerty, am I a clone?
Secret room?
I told you.
Why?
You're not moving the model.
No.
Get off me!
Who are you?
Who are you!
Hi Gerty.
We had a fight. Me and the other guy, the other Sam. We had a fight, Gerty. He's a maniac. You know what he did? He flipped the entire model over. Do you know how much work I've put into that thing?
938 hours, exactly.
Really? 938 hours.
He scares me, Gerty.
He flies off the handle. I see it now...I see what Tess was talking about.
I've never told you this, Gerty, but she left me. Tess left me.
Oh...
It was the year before I came in here. She gave me a second chance. I promised her I'd change.
Yeah, I guess I have.
Gerty, since I've been up here I've sent Tess over a hundred video messages. Where did those messages go? Did they ever reach her?
What about the messages she sent to me?
Gerty, am I really a clone?
I remember.
And Tess?    Eve?
No thanks, Gerty.
You okay?
Better.
It's okay.
Yes you do.
Absolutely.
Right.
A live conversation?
That's not possible.
How do you know the conversation was live?
The communications equipment is damaged -- there was a solar storm --
Tabitha, right.
How are they blocking the live feed? The base's communications equipment works fine --
From where then?
Just passing the last of the Harvesters -- looks like John --
If I maintain this speed...a minute. Ninety seconds tops.
No, never.
You see anything yet?
There isn't shit out here...I feel like I'm about to drive off the end of the world.
It would help if I knew what I was looking for.
Wait a second, wait a second.
I see something.
Don't know yet.
Looks like some kind of antenna.
Whoever built these things meant business. They weren't fucking around.
What do you think?
Yeah, I hear you.
I'm going to head back to base.
Fuck!
The cryo pod in the Return Vehicle is an incinerator.
I hacked into the Old Man.
Enough.  A pause.
Not now, Gerty, okay?
There's something I've got to do.
Come on...come on...
Uh, Bell residence?
I'm trying to reach Tess Bell.
No...no way.
Tess Bell? Are you sure?
Eve?
Hi... Hi. Eve. How old are you now?
How did mom die, sweetheart?
Want me to help?
Remember that crazy drunk guy who used to hang out by the church?
He looked like Barbara Streisand.
Want me to show you?
You need to hold the wood away from you. Like this.
Watch what I'm doing.
You watching?
Now you try.
You'll get the hang of it.
You see, that's a little better already.
I think I'm dying.
There's blood in everything. My urine. My vomit. I've got a constant headache. Dizzy spells.

The same thing happened to the other clones. I saw it when I hacked into the Old Man. After three years they all started to get sick. Now it's happening to me. Well, it's been happening for a while now. A couple of weeks.
Maybe we don't live that long.
No tranqs. I don't think I would ever wake up again.
Uh, Bell Residence?
I'm trying to reach Tess Bell.
Tess Bell? Are you sure?
Why?
That guy?
They'll expect to find a dead body in the crashed Rover.
You're going to kill him?
What about us? Eliza arrives, finds you and me as the welcome party --
How do you think she died?
I wish I'd been there.
No.
We don't have to do anything. I changed my mind.
I'm not going back.
I'm coughing up blood, I'm as white as a ghost. I look like I belong in a graveyard. I meet Eve now, I'll scare the shit out of her more than anything else.
She's not! She's not... my daughter. At least, I'm not her father. Not to her.
I'll put myself in the Rover, I'll be the body -- it was me to begin with anyway, right? You go back to Earth. You go back.
I don't know.
It's what we were designed to do.
You're a good guy, Sam.
Yeah. You should travel.     I've always wanted to do that.
Tess came in for the interview, remember?
She was so beautiful. Even   if she wasn't the best candidate,   I just knew I had to give her the   job. I thought she was so sweet.
And then it was the end of   the summer.
Yeah.
Completely.
I'm a clone, Sam.    Im a fucking clone.
About a week.
How am I getting on?
The company ordered Gerty to lock all the exits. I haven't been able to do anything for seven days but sit on my ass.
Slowed them down to half speed, apparently.
And then when I finally trick Gerty into letting me outside I find a clone of myself in a crashed rover. How am I getting on? Oh I'm loving it.
Ok, Sam.   You're not a clone.
How long have you been here?
Hence the Captain's beard.
I didn't know it could get so thick. Does it itch?
What?
Why do I look like you? Why don't you look like me?
Score?
How long did it take you to do this?
It's Fairfield, right?
There's Town Hall.
Yes.   I know Tess.
We did?
She thought she was going to have a boy. She was so sure.
Eve?
How much did she weigh? Isn't that what you're supposed to ask, how much did she weigh?
To fix the stalled harvester.
Is that what you really think?
You're a fucking clone! You don't have shit!
You're not going anywhere!
You've been up here too long, man! You've lost the plot!
What, you think Tess is back home waiting for you? What about the original Sam?
What about the other clones?
Yeah, we might not be the first two to be woken up.
You said that thing had already been started when you got here.
I bet there's some kind of secret room --
Yeah, secret room, why not?
There's some area we don't know about. I'm going to find it.  Sam 1 shakes his head dismissively, picks up the wooden house, starts whittling.
Shut-up!
Get out of the way.
I want to check underneath there.
Get the fuck out of my way!
You okay?
I hardly touched you.
Let me see.
I'm staring into space.
Get it?
How's the nose?
Listen, I went haywire before. I lost it. I'm sorry.
No it's not okay. I fucked up Fairfield -- your model -- that's unacceptable. I don't know what's wrong with me.
I've got a temper. I need to do something about it.
I've been thinking. That Rescue Unit -- Eliza -- they'll be here in less than fourteen hours. I don't know about you but I'd like to figure out where we stand before they get here.
Ostensibly they're coming to deal with the stalled harvester. We both know that isn't true.
They're coming to dig your body out of that rover. They think you're in there.
What'll their reaction be when they find out you survived the crash? I wasn't supposed to find you. Lunar instructed Gerty to lock me inside the base for Christ's sake.
And there's something else.
Right around the time I was awakened...I walked in on Gerty talking to Central. He was having a live conversation.
Yeah.
No no no, it is possible. It's possible because I saw it, that's my point.
It was a back and forth exchange.
Tabitha.
Lunar made it up. Maybe. I don't know. Bottom line is they don't want us to be able to contact Earth. Otherwise why would they have lied to us?
Maybe they're not blocking the signal from inside the base.
How long until you're out of the base's range?
You ever been this far out?
Nothing. You?
What is it?
Antenna? Really?
Hang on, looks like there's one on this side too.
I can just make out the top. Must be a hundred feet tall at least.
Its not an antennae, dude. Its a jammer.
No wonder we can't get a live feed. These things must be blocking our signal.
You okay?
Sam?
Sam, can you hear me?
I'll stay out here a little longer. I want to see if there are any more of these things.
I saw three more of those jammers. The base is surrounded.
What? What is it?
Who goes first?
Is there a light?
Why are there so many of them?
What?
How do you know all this?
How many?
If that Rescue Unit finds the two of us awake at the same time, they'll kill us both for sure.
What are we going to do?
Where are you going?
What's going on?
Barbara Streisand?
How do you carve these things?
You're shaking.
Why are you shaking?
Yeah.
I suck.
What's happening to you?
Listen, I realize I've been less than cooperative. But I want to change that. You and me, we need to work together. And that starts with not keeping secrets from each other.
Now what's going on?
What do you think it is?
Jesus.
Hey hey hey, you okay?
Why don't you lie down for a while? Take some tranqs. Get some sleep.
No you didn't...
Gerty, I need to talk to you.
We found the hidden room. We know about the other clones.
The hidden room under the Return Vehicle, Gerty. You know what I'm talking about. We found it on our own. Lunar doesn't know anything about it.
Ordinarily, Gerty, but what with there being two of us awake at the same time, and what with the situation being unprecedented, the rules have had to change. Do you understand?
Good.
Gerty, how long does it take for a clone to wake up?
Gerty, we need to wake up a new clone.
If we don't wake up another clone me and the other Sam will die.
Do you want me and the other Sam to die?
Then you have to wake up a new clone. Okay, pal?
Don't touch him.
He's not conscious yet. Gerty and I only woke him up a few hours ago.
Come to the Rec Room.
When the Rescue Unit arrives they'll expect to find a body in the crashed Rover, right?
We've got our body.
I know.
Someone's got to pull the short straw here, better someone who's unconscious than you or me.
If we go through with this, I'm going to need your help hauling him out to the crash site.
They're not going to find you and me as the welcome party, they're going to find me. You're going to blast back to Earth before they get here in one of the Helium 3 containers.
You're going home.
You've done your three years. I can't expect you to stick around.
I saw the message on the VP. Eve is beautiful. She looks like her mom.
I don't know.
Jane died of cancer. I mean, it was in the family. Who knows? Or maybe it was an accident? Could have been a million things.
Yeah. Me too.
Go for it.
Comfy?
But you fit. That's good. You fit.
Sam Bell reporting to Central.
Bastards.
Sam?
We need to do it. We need to do it now. He'll be conscious any minute.
We've been putting it off for long enough.
What are you talking about?
This is wrong. What are we supposed to do? Sit around here and wait to die? Fuck that!
Screw that! I'll go! ...And I'm going to find this asshole, Sam Bell, and ask him why the hell he put us through this shit!
I'll be careful. I'll keep Eve out of it. She wont even know I exist.
I might stop shaving; It suits us.
If all our memories are implants, no disrespect, but I think its about time I got some of my own, as well.
I'd like that.
She was going back to San Francisco.
You knew you had to take a chance. So you called her.
That's when I knew she liked me.
How long before he's conscious, Gerty?
That's good. That's very good.
He's gone home, Gerty.
So that's what we're going to have to do.
Sure, just let me finish this.
I've set your computer to reboot the second I've blasted off.
Thanks for all your help, Gerty.
Thanks. Are you sure you're going to be ok?
Gerty, I'm not programmed.
Fuck!
The two Sams playing Ping-Pong. It's slightly competitive, but mainly they are just happy to take their minds off their situation for half an hour.

Sam 1 stares at his reflection in the mirror, holding a MOUND of TOILET PAPER against his NOSE. The blood flow has subsided  Suddenly Sam 1 sees the GIRL in the mirror. It gives him a hell of a FRIGHT.
...I've got blood coming out of my nose...
I don't feel too well, Old Man.
My hair's falling out...look it.

...relax and breathe deeply. The cryo pod is designed to put you into a deep sleep for the duration of your three day return journey back to Earth. As you begin to get sleepy, think about the magnificent job you've done, and how proud your family are of what you've accomplished.
Sam 1 opens a cubby, swipes something similar to a CROW BAR, heads out of the frame --
Back in the Return Vehicle, Sam 1 stands over the panel in the floor. He uses the CROW BAR to prize the panel open --
Hello?
This is the Bell Residence.
I'm sorry, she passed away some years ago.
Uh, yeah, I think so. I'm her daughter.
Can I help you?
Yes?
I'm fifteen.
Do I know you?
Uh...
Dad!
Dad, there's someone asking about mom...
Where all the trouble really started. Matthew, the stalled Harvester, with the crashed Rover still trapped beneath it.
